page.title: 07Birds in our area
page.content: The increase in winter barley and wheat and oil seed rape favours skylarks but not corn bunting or lapwing.Snipe and curlew are seldom seen due to draining of damp meadows. Several species of water bird nest around the spring-fed ornamental lake in Aston Rowant such as the tufted duck.The little owl breeds here as do the pheasant and red-legged partridge.The latter are game birds and the "cover" provided for them benefits other species.Chinnor cement works quarry provides a further habitat.The Canada goose breeds there.The collared dove has also found its own nitch in the ecosystem.The nightingale no longer breeds along the foot of the Chilterns. The barn owl population has severly declined,due to the construction of modern barns.House martins and swallows have adapted and will use old or new buildings for their nesting sites.
